content.question: For time <math alttext="t is greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a particle moves in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></math>-plane with velocity vector given by <math alttext="v of t, equals, open angled bracket, the natural log of, open parenthesis, t cubed, plus 3 t, plus 1, close parenthesis, comma, 1 minus the natural log of, open parenthesis, t plus 3, close parenthesis, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the particle is at position <math alttext="the point with coordinates 1 comma negative 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the particle’s acceleration vector at time <math alttext="t equals 2.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
